text: Las Dos Naciones Cigar Factory is a historic building in Nogales, Arizona. It was built in 1899 by Maurice Stevens for the Las Dos Naciones Cigar Factory, and designed in the Colonial Revival and Greek Revival architectural styles. With The company, co-founded by Richard and Lewis Fleisher in 1897, was the only cigar factory in the Southwestern United States until it closed down in 1917. The building has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since August 29, 1985. ==References== Category:Historic cigar factories Category:National Register of Historic Places in Santa Cruz County, Arizona Category:Colonial Revival architecture in Arizona Category:Greek Revival architecture in Arizona Category:Commercial buildings completed in 1899 Category:1899 establishments in Arizona Territory
title: Las Dos Naciones Cigar Factory
